article.headline: George Mason 78, Manhattan 66
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP)-- Tony Skinn scored 17 points and Jai Lewis added 14 to lead George Mason to a 78-66 win over Manhattan Saturday. The Patriots (16-10) went on a 15-4 run midway through the second half to put away the Jaspers (13-12), who had already rallied once to erase a nine-point deficit and take a brief 47-46 lead. With the game tied at 49, Lewis started the decisive run with a layup and Skinn finished it off with a fast-break basket to put George Mason ahead 64-53 with 5:30 left. C.J. Anderson matched a career-high with 25 points for Manhattan, which lost its sixth straight on the road. Lamar Butler made four 3-pointers on his way to 13 points for the Patriots, who won their 10th home game of the season-- the seventh straight season George Mason has won 10 or more games at home. John Vaughan had 12 points for George Mason, which shot 62 percent from the floor in the second half. Peter Mulligan also had 25 points for the Jaspers, who made 1 of 13 3-pointers and were outrebounded 40-31. ^

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
